definition: partial towards sth/to prefer/to incline/erroneous tendencies (Leftist or Revisionist deviation)
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
surname Xiang
towards/to face/to turn towards/direction/to support/to side with/shortly before/formerly/always/all along/(suffix) suitable for .../oriented to ...
to tend toward/to guide/variant of 向[xiang4]
variant of 向[xiang4]/direction/orientation/to face/to turn toward/to/towards/shortly before/formerly
lit. to willfully go towards the mountain although knowing that it has tigers (idiom)/fig. to take a risk despite knowing the dangers
pinyin: ming2 zhi1 shan1 you3 hu3 , pian1 xiang4 hu3 shan1 xing2
containing_words.word: 明知山有虎，偏向虎山行

sentences.english: He tilted his head to one side, and his eyes were curious.
sentences.chinese: 他把头偏向一侧，眼里充满了好奇。

sentences.english: The refractive status showed hyperopic shift after cycloplegia .
sentences.chinese: 睫状肌麻痹后之屈光状态显示偏向远视。

sentences.english: The asymmetry has been found in athletes, in CEOs and in accident reports.
sentences.chinese: 这种偏向存在于运动员中，总裁中，意外报告中也有。

sentences.english: Her charm prejudiced the judges in her favour.
sentences.chinese: 她姿色迷人，因而评委都偏向她。

sentences.english: Alan Redfern, Law and practice of International Commercial Arbitration.
sentences.chinese: 本书偏向于解释国际商务仲裁的一般规则。

sentences.english: But then again, I am biased.
sentences.chinese: 话又说回来，我还是偏向我自身。

sentences.english: Do not turn to idols or make gods of cast metal for yourselves.
sentences.chinese: 你们不可偏向虚无的神，也不可为自己铸造神像。

sentences.english: Low tire pressure could be the cause; check pressure first.
sentences.chinese: 偏向可能是轮胎内压的原因，应先查胎压。

sentences.english: Even former US enemy Vietnam looks to the US to counter-balance them.
sentences.chinese: 就算是曾经美国的敌人越南也偏向美国来制衡中国。

sentences.english: A little too much in either way and you end up failing at every turn.
sentences.chinese: 过分的偏向两者中的任何一方都会使你转向失败。

sentences.english: And he that passeth over from justice to sin, God hath prepared such an one for the sword.
sentences.chinese: 离弃正义而偏向罪恶的人，上主为他准备了刀剑。

sentences.english: Because every one of us inherited Adam and Eve's inclination toward independence from God.
sentences.chinese: 由于我们每个人都继续了亚当夏娃离弃神的偏向。

sentences.english: Linguists often describe Chinese as a language that goes heavy on verbs.
sentences.chinese: 语言学家常说汉语是一门偏向于动词的语言。

sentences.english: The content of curriculum inclines non-disciplinary.
sentences.chinese: 课程内容逐渐偏向非学科化。

sentences.english: He will not tolerate any deviation in the service of alien gods.
sentences.chinese: 他无法容忍对任何异教神灵的偏向。

sentences.english: Never­theless, the balance had shifted in favor of small organizations.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，当时天平还是偏向了小型企业一侧。

to stress in a prejudiced way/to emphasize sth unduly
to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations
trend/tendency/orientation
direction/trend/to incline
to place particular emphasis on
to prefer/to be partial to sth/preference
to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite
to pay attention to/to emphasize
to compare/to contrast/comparatively/relatively/quite/comparison
opposite/contrary
relatively/opposite/to resist/to oppose/relative/vis-a-vis/counterpart
radical/extreme/extremist
to draw close to
to change direction/fig. to change one's stance
to get lost/to lose one's way
comparatively/relatively/fairly
